mt19937ar.c

00001 /* 
00002    A C-program for MT19937, with initialization improved 2002/1/26.
00003    Coded by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto.
00004 
00005    Before using, initialize the state by using init_genrand(seed)  
00006    or init_by_array(init_key, key_length).

00044 #include <stdio.h>
00045 
00046 /* Period parameters */  
00047 #define N 624
00048 #define M 397
00049 #define MATRIX_A 0x9908b0dfUL   /* constant vector a */
00050 #define UPPER_MASK 0x80000000UL /* most significant w-r bits */
00051 #define LOWER_MASK 0x7fffffffUL /* least significant r bits */
00052 
00053 static unsigned long mt[N]; /* the array for the state vector  */
00054 static int mti=N+1; /* mti==N+1 means mt[N] is not initialized */
00055 
00056 /* initializes mt[N] with a seed */
00057 void init_genrand(unsigned long s)
00058 {
00059     mt[0]= s & 0xffffffffUL;
00060     for (mti=1; mti<N; mti++) {
00061         mt[mti] = 
00062             (1812433253UL * (mt[mti-1] ^ (mt[mti-1] >> 30)) + mti); 
00063         /* See Knuth TAOCP Vol2. 3rd Ed. P.106 for multiplier. */
00064         /* In the previous versions, MSBs of the seed affect   */
00065         /* only MSBs of the array mt[].                        */
00066         /* 2002/01/09 modified by Makoto Matsumoto             */
00067         mt[mti] &= 0xffffffffUL;
00068         /* for >32 bit machines */
00069     }
00070 }
00071 
00072 /* initialize by an array with array-length */
00073 /* init_key is the array for initializing keys */
00074 /* key_length is its length */
00075 /* slight change for C++, 2004/2/26 */
00076 void init_by_array(unsigned long init_key[], int key_length)
00077 {
00078     int i, j, k;
00079     init_genrand(19650218UL);
00080     i=1; j=0;
00081     k = (N>key_length ? N : key_length);
00082     for (; k; k--) {
00083         mt[i] = (mt[i] ^ ((mt[i-1] ^ (mt[i-1] >> 30)) * 1664525UL))
00084           + init_key[j] + j; /* non linear */
00085         mt[i] &= 0xffffffffUL; /* for WORDSIZE > 32 machines */
00086         i++; j++;
00087         if (i>=N) { mt[0] = mt[N-1]; i=1; }
00088         if (j>=key_length) j=0;
00089     }
00090     for (k=N-1; k; k--) {
00091         mt[i] = (mt[i] ^ ((mt[i-1] ^ (mt[i-1] >> 30)) * 1566083941UL))
00092           - i; /* non linear */
00093         mt[i] &= 0xffffffffUL; /* for WORDSIZE > 32 machines */
00094         i++;
00095         if (i>=N) { mt[0] = mt[N-1]; i=1; }
00096     }
00097 
00098     mt[0] = 0x80000000UL; /* MSB is 1; assuring non-zero initial array */ 
00099 }
00100 
00101 /* generates a random number on [0,0xffffffff]-interval */
00102 unsigned long genrand_int32(void)
00103 {
00104     unsigned long y;
00105     static unsigned long mag01[2]={0x0UL, MATRIX_A};
00106     /* mag01[x] = x * MATRIX_A  for x=0,1 */
00107 
00108     if (mti >= N) { /* generate N words at one time */
00109         int kk;
00110 
00111         if (mti == N+1)   /* if init_genrand() has not been called, */
00112             init_genrand(5489UL); /* a default initial seed is used */
00113 
00114         for (kk=0;kk<N-M;kk++) {
00115             y = (mt[kk]&UPPER_MASK)|(mt[kk+1]&LOWER_MASK);
00116             mt[kk] = mt[kk+M] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1UL];
00117         }
00118         for (;kk<N-1;kk++) {
00119             y = (mt[kk]&UPPER_MASK)|(mt[kk+1]&LOWER_MASK);
00120             mt[kk] = mt[kk+(M-N)] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1UL];
00121         }
00122         y = (mt[N-1]&UPPER_MASK)|(mt[0]&LOWER_MASK);
00123         mt[N-1] = mt[M-1] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1UL];
00124 
00125         mti = 0;
00126     }
00127   
00128     y = mt[mti++];
00129 
00130     /* Tempering */
00131     y ^= (y >> 11);
00132     y ^= (y << 7) & 0x9d2c5680UL;
00133     y ^= (y << 15) & 0xefc60000UL;
00134     y ^= (y >> 18);
00135 
00136     return y;
00137 }
00138 
00139 /* generates a random number on [0,0x7fffffff]-interval */
00140 long genrand_int31(void)
00141 {
00142     return (long)(genrand_int32()>>1);
00143 }
00144 
00145 /* generates a random number on [0,1]-real-interval */
00146 double genrand_real1(void)
00147 {
00148     return genrand_int32()*(1.0/4294967295.0); 
00149     /* divided by 2^32-1 */ 
00150 }
00151 
00152 /* generates a random number on [0,1)-real-interval */
00153 double genrand_real2(void)
00154 {
00155     return genrand_int32()*(1.0/4294967296.0); 
00156     /* divided by 2^32 */
00157 }
00158 
00159 /* generates a random number on (0,1)-real-interval */
00160 double genrand_real3(void)
00161 {
00162     return (((double)genrand_int32()) + 0.5)*(1.0/4294967296.0); 
00163     /* divided by 2^32 */
00164 }
00165 
00166 /* generates a random number on [0,1) with 53-bit resolution*/
00167 double genrand_res53(void) 
00168 { 
00169     unsigned long a=genrand_int32()>>5, b=genrand_int32()>>6; 
00170     return(a*67108864.0+b)*(1.0/9007199254740992.0); 
00171 } 
00172 /* These real versions are due to Isaku Wada, 2002/01/09 added */
